node.text:
Utah State Representative Steve Christiansen appeared on Black News Tonight to discuss his attempt to ban Critical Race Theory from schools. As usual, he presented no tangible evidence that this was an actual problem. And at the end, he demonstrated that he has yet to seriously engage critical race theory. 

For the full 20 minute interview, visit the @bncnews YouTube page…

Suit @damari_savile
Shirt @Hugoboss 
Tie @IsaacMizrahi
Pocket square @IsaacMizrahi
Makeup @rayofjoy_beauty
Stylist @AHFStylist #AHStyling 
#ahstylingmens

node.text:
On Black News Tonight, I hosted a conversation about rape culture. In the aftermath of last week’s controversies around Bill Cosby and Judge Joe Brown, I wanted to create space to engage and educate our audience on broader conversations about sexual violence, consent, and the silencing of survivors. I was joined by experts @salamishah and @afrolez, who broke it all down. Check it out and weigh in!

Suit @styledby_dm
Shirt @RalphLauren
Tie @damari_savile
Pocket square @The_cliftonwilson_brand 
Makeup @fashionfacez
Stylist @AHStyling @AHFStylist #ahstylingmens

node.title: Bill Cosby, Joe Brown, and the politics of rape culture

node.text:
On Black News Tonight, I spoke to Trick Daddy, who defended his comments about Beyoncé’s singing. Although he backtracked a little, he largely remained committed to dying on this hill. (For the record, I think he’s dead wrong.) @trickdaddydollars even sent a message to the #beyhive: “I’m more afraid of roaches than bees.” Thoughts?

Black News Tonight airs M-F at 8PM ET on @BNCNews

Black News Channel (BNC) is in 56 million cable homes, including XFINITY (1116), FIOS (612), DirectTV (342), Dish (361), ATT, and Spectrum. It’s also on Roku Channel, Firetv, Tivo, PlutoTV, Samsung Plus, Vizio, & more!

node.text:
In an exclusive Black News Tonight interview, Dr. Aruna Khilanani discusses her controversial speech at Yale University. While most focused on her remarks about her violent fantasies, her speech was filled with provocative remarks about white supremacy. In this clip, Dr. Khilanani explains why she said there were “no good apples” among White people. She also explains her claim that White people are “psychopathic.” Thoughts?

To see the full interview, visit the @bncnews YouTube page.

node.text:
Last night on Black News Tonight, I invited two of the leading voices against Critical Race Theory and social justice discourses. These two gentlemen, both of whom hold PhDs and one of whom identifies as a “world-level expert on Critical Race Theory” asked me to point out the mistakes in their “social justice cheat sheet.” So I did. Then one of them (the “expert”) tried to dismiss my words by launching an academic word salad at me. To his surprise, I read books. Here’s what happened:

node.text:
On Black News Tonight, the legend KG (@tic_pix) stopped by to talk about his work with National Black Bank Fund and Hoop It Up. Of course, I took the opportunity to ask him about his dream “Big 3,” his old Celtics squad’s chances against this year’s Nets, and his views on the recent criticism of Danny Ainge. Salute to the Big Ticket for coming through. He’s a great dude, despite being a Celtic!!!

node.text:
Last night, on Black News Tonight, I interviewed conservative @thecjpearson, an opponent of Critical Race Theory. He says he has read CRT, taken courses, and been on panels. I asked him a simple question: name ONE Critical Race Theory author, book, or article title. He could not. These aren’t trick questions. I only ask that you READ the thing that you say you hate so much. Unfortunately, this isn’t about critical race theory. This is about creating ideological bogeymen that are strategically deployed, as part of a moral panic, to prevent any substantive talk about systemic racism and white supremacy in America.

Black News Tonight airs Monday to Friday at 8PM on BNC, which can be found in 52 million cable homes, including XFINITY (1116), DirectTV (342), Dish (361), ATT, and Spectrum. It’s also available on Roku Channel, firetv, PlutoTV, Visio, Samsung Plus, Vizio, and more!!!

Also, if you have Verizon FIOS, you can watch it by going to the Pluto Channel (839), and then choosing BNC.

node.text:
On Black News Tonight, Dr. Su’ad Abdul Khabeer (@doctasuad) talks about the legacy of the Black Power Movement. Michael Aggrey and Samuel Takyi speak about Ghana winning it’s first Olympic medal since 1992. @seangarrettthepen tells us about his new record label ‘Hey Young World’. 8pm ET only on @bncnews.

Black News Tonight airs M-F at 8PM ET on @BNCNews. 

Black News Channel (BNC) is in 56 million cable homes, including XFINITY (1116), FIOS (612), DirectTV (342), Dish (361), ATT, and Spectrum. It’s also on Roku Channel, Firetv, Tivo, PlutoTV, Samsung Plus, Vizio, & more!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Marc Lamont Hill on August 05, 2021. May be an image of 2 people, child and people standing.

node.text: #tbt Spring 96. Braces off. New oversized polo. Black Kufi. Looking shahada fresh. Never had felt so happy. So free. So confident. So worthy of good love. Most of us don’t recognize the “good old days” until they’re behind us.

node.text:
Utah State Representative Steve Christiansen appeared on Black News Tonight to discuss his attempt to ban Critical Race Theory from schools. As usual, he presented no tangible evidence that this was an actual problem. And at the end, he demonstrated that he has yet to seriously engage critical race theory. 

For the full 20 minute interview, visit the @bncnews YouTube page…
